metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8321 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in RubyGems 2.6 and later through 3.0.2. Since Gem::UserInteraction#verbose calls say without escaping, escape sequence injection is possible. It was discovered that Gem::UserInteraction#verbose failed to escape certain characters. An attacker could use this vulnerability inject escape sequences into a victim's terminal.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8321` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

jruby - 1.5.6-9+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.13
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.13
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.13
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> ruby{1.9.1,2.0,2.3} and jruby ship an embedded rubygems.

criterions.comment: jruby package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.6-9+deb8u2build0.14.04.1~esm2').
ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.14').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.13').
